title: [BUG] SegFault when doing a host to GPU columnar transition for a very large data string.
body:
**Describe the bug**
I don't have a tone of information yet on this. I was trying to reproduce/debug some slowness with a specific query and it looked like it was related to a regular expression problem. I thought it might be related to a very large string, so I created a 300 KiB string with a lot of rows. The string was duplicated for each of the rows.  When I tried to read it in from parquet it would fail with out of memory errors because the split code could not deal with it yet.  When I turned off the parquet reader I got a segfault.

```
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007fecf9052416, pid=1597425, tid=0x00007fecbc9f9700
#
# JRE version: OpenJDK Runtime Environment (8.0_382-b05) (build 1.8.0_382-8u382-ga-1~20.04.1-b05)
# Java VM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (25.382-b05 mixed mode linux-amd64 compressed oops)
# Problematic frame:
# v  ~StubRoutines::jbyte_disjoint_arraycopy
#
# Failed to write core dump. Core dumps have been disabled. To enable core dumping, try "ulimit -c unlimited" before starting Java again
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as:
# /.../hs_err_pid1597425.log
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://bugreport.java.com/bugreport/crash.jsp
#
```

Looking at the file I see a stack trace of.

```
Stack: [0x00007fecbc8f9000,0x00007fecbc9fa000],  sp=0x00007fecbc9f6ae0,  free space=1014k
Native frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code, C=native code)
v  ~StubRoutines::jbyte_disjoint_arraycopy
J 17997 C2 ai.rapids.cudf.HostColumnVector$ColumnBuilder.appendUTF8String([BII)Lai/rapids/cudf/HostColumnVector$ColumnBuilder; (222 bytes
) @ 0x00007fecfc3af227 [0x00007fecfc3af120+0x107]
J 18107 C1 com.nvidia.spark.rapids.ColumnarCopyHelper.stringCopy(Lorg/apache/spark/sql/vectorized/ColumnVector;Lai/rapids/cudf/HostColumn
Vector$ColumnBuilder;I)V (77 bytes) @ 0x00007fecfc3fa97c [0x00007fecfc3fa580+0x3fc]
j  com.nvidia.spark.rapids.HostColumnarToGpu$.columnarCopy(Lorg/apache/spark/sql/vectorized/ColumnVector;Lai/rapids/cudf/HostColumnVector
$ColumnBuilder;Lorg/apache/spark/sql/types/DataType;I)V+376
j  com.nvidia.spark.rapids.HostColumnarToGpu.columnarCopy(Lorg/apache/spark/sql/vectorized/ColumnVector;Lai/rapids/cudf/HostColumnVector$
ColumnBuilder;Lorg/apache/spark/sql/types/DataType;I)V+7
j  com.nvidia.spark.rapids.GpuColumnVector$GpuColumnarBatchBuilder.copyColumnar(Lorg/apache/spark/sql/vectorized/ColumnVector;II)V+24
j  com.nvidia.spark.rapids.HostToGpuCoalesceIterator.$anonfun$addBatchToConcat$2(Lcom/nvidia/spark/rapids/HostToGpuCoalesceIterator;Lorg/
apache/spark/sql/vectorized/ColumnarBatch;II)V+11
```

I was able to make this happen twice, but the data took 45 mins to write out on the CPU, and is over 100 MiB in size, so I am just going to file the issue for now so I don't lose track of it. I'll spend some time debugging it after the long weekend.
